initial_reviews.review_title: Best in customer support and inbuilt community
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces addresses the need for efficient automation in digital marketing, particularly in managing email campaigns through ConvertKit and generating AI responses with GPT. By automating these tasks, it saves considerable time and effort, allowing me to focus on strategic initiatives. The integration with ConvertKit streamlines email marketing, while the GPT-powered responses enhance customer interaction and personalization. This results in increased productivity, better targeting, and more effective campaigns, ultimately boosting overall marketing performance.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Active Pieces typically has fewer integrations compared to Zapier, which supports thousands of apps. This limitation means that we might not find all the apps we need to connect workflows.

But i hope they bring maximum integrations

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Firstly, it automates repetitive tasks, significantly reducing the time spent on manual processes like data entry and social media posting. This frees up my time to focus on strategic activities that drive business growth. Secondly, it integrates seamlessly with various marketing tools and platforms, ensuring smooth data flow and better campaign management. Overall, Activepieces enhances efficiency, improves productivity, and allows for more precise targeting and personalization in marketing efforts.

initial_reviews.review_title: Our E-commerce Success Story
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
The intuitive interface, diverse functionalities, powerful integrations like ChatGPT, efficiency gains, and collaborative community aspect make Activepieces a valuable tool that has positively impacted our E-commerce operations.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
The initial setup and learning how to utilize all the features efficiently can be a bit complex and time-consuming.
Although Activepieces integrates with a variety of apps and platforms, there may be certain specific integrations that are not readily available.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
At our E-commerce business, Activepieces has been a game-changer, revolutionizing how we operate and interact with our customers.

Through the ChatGPT integration, we've personalized our customer communication like never before. Sending tailored product recommendations and updates has strengthened our customer relationships and increased engagement.

By automating our social media marketing efforts with Activepieces, we've seen a significant boost in our online presence and customer interactions. Scheduling posts, analyzing engagement metrics, and responding to queries has never been easier.

Activepieces has truly elevated our E-commerce operations.

initial_reviews.review_title: A solid alternative to Zapier
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces is a breath of fresh air when you compare it to the currently established Business Automation Tools, The fact it's Opensource and provides the ability to deploy a fully featured self hosted environment of AP free of charge allowing you to have as many flows as you want, for as many runs as you need is extremely competitive in the market and quite generous of the AP team.

AP offers many of the essential BA tools that you would need, Such as webhooks, Integrations with many common Google services such as Excel/Drive/Gmail and much more. And the interface provided is quite simple and clean, only showing the important details relevant to the current piece/flow you're working with.

And the best part is that it's only going to get better and larger! every week the team anounces new Pieces ready to be used in AP either from the awesome community contributors ( yey opensource! )  or the AP team themselves! So it's only a matter of time until AP catches up with industry giants like Zapier.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
I would like to see more detailed documentation for AP. I've struggled with some Pieces that had no documentation on the website.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use AP to automate very strenous manual labour involving transmitting form submissions from google forms to my own backend services, This would be nearly impossible to achieve a fully automated cycle of data transmission between completely seperate services if not for AP's Google Forms Trigger and many other Pieces that it offers

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy, efficient Automation
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces has been the easiest and most user friendly automation software I've used, I've found it extremely easy to set up flows and get automations up and running in a very short space of time.
The community site and discord servers are very active and have lots of information, definitely worth checking out if you ever get stuck.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Sometimes the documentation can be quite vague around pieces, it's definitely improving but showing use cases of how core pieces can be implemented would be really helpful. Luckily there are examples from users on youtube that show this.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces helps me connect my tech stack together. It enables me to set up automations to save time and save on manual tasks. If a software I'm using is missing functionality, instead of having to purchase another and migrate, I can use activepieces to connect my existing solutions and gain that functionality.

initial_reviews.review_title: Top No-Code Automation Tool
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
- User-friendly, even for those without technical skills
- Highly flexible and powerful, with options to add code when needed
- Open-source, allowing for customization and extension
- Affordable pricing
- Supported by strong funding and a talented team
- AI assistance for adding code as needed

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
If I had to be super critical, the documentation could be more a little more comprehensive. However, updates are in progress, and the active Discord community is super helpful for urgent questions. I'm confident the documentation will improve over time.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces helps automate time-consuming and repetitive tasks. If a task can be done in the cloud and needs to be repeated, Activepieces can probably handle it. Additionally, it automates error-prone tasks, ensuring they are completed accurately, literally saving hours of manual work each and every week!

initial_reviews.review_title: Visual workflow builder with great potential. *Update: lots of development and improvements last 6m
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
The custom code piece that allows you to use javascript and npm packages for lots of flexibility. *update: the new ai hints for custom code is fantastic! Also, the custom API builder got some nice improvements.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
*update after 6+ months: the team has been constantly updating the system and adding new integrations. The limited amount of native integrations available, which means you end up having to read the API docs for your apps and write the code yourself.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Integrating different apps and services, automating workflows. Mostly I use it in combination with no code builders like Knack and Frontly. A user action will trigger a webhook that then allows me to customize a workflow that might not be possible inside the app builder.

initial_reviews.review_title: While the tools is clearly in early stage it growing rapidly !
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
It's very easy to get started. Major applications in the cloud have their components, and it's easy to integrate with any of them. As a developer, I'm also very happy to have an open ecosystem to work with. I can self-host the application, deploy it privately, and develop custom components for very specific projects while reusing common ones.

Modifications to existing components get approved quickly. Adding new components is relatively easy because all the building blocks already exist.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
As a developer, most of the time I can figure things out by looking at the code or searching the web for technical details. Documentation is probably the area where Activepieces still needs to improve, especially the online documentation. A good example is how to get ClientID and Secret from some integrations. Either the steps are absent or obsolete, which makes it a bit longer to integrate those flows.

Otherwise, the number of components and actions is behind Make or Zapier. But it is certainly growing rapidly, and as a developer, I'm very happy to contribute a little in that area with development in Odoo, Zoho CRM, Zoho Books, and others.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Quickly integrate multiple application in the cloud or on primise which could not be possible with Zapier and MAke because I cannot code my own components.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, open source and with a very active community
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
- It's open source so you can host it yourself. Their hosted version is awesome too with very competitive pricing.
- Integrations and autorhization with external services are handled very well.
- Community driven product with lots of contributors adding new "Pieces" (or integrations) all the time.
- You can develop your own pieces or integrations and then share them with the community!
- Lots of UX/UI improvements in the past months that make it really easy to integrate and debug flows (including incomining/outgoing webhooks which are a pain to impkement in some platforms)

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
- Some pieces are still missing some functionality depending on the third party service they connect to, so if you need to implement something specific be sure to check the related pieces documentation to see if the actions you need are supported (or, if you have a developer on hand, just go ahead and implement the required actions)

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
They help us automate flows that used to require custom development and shortening the time to launch in many cases.
We also get better visibility on flow execution and easier access to scheduling, maintenance and logs for non-developers.

initial_reviews.review_title: Activepieces - an emerging player in automation

I love that Activepieces offer various complicated features for automation with a very simple and intuitive interface.

I also like that Activepieces has a lot of great "templates" for the automations. The newly added ones regarding ChatGPT are simply super handy.

Activepieces also have great triggers like timing trigger, such as Every hour, Every Day, Every minute etc.

And the user experience is smooth and convenient. I don't really need specific guide, just exploring templates and I have been able to create the "flows" to automate my workflow with ease.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
The integrations can definitely be better. Currently the apps integrated into Activepieces are limited, and the speed of apps integration can be faster. Anyway, most of the apps I need are there now and I am excitedly waiting for new integrations to come in the future.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces introduced a very simple approach for automation. Perhaps the easiest automation apps amongst those I have. I can integrate my apps with only a few clicks with Activepieces in just a few minutes, with barely any tutorial or guidance.

Certainly it cannot be compared right now with industry leaders such as Zappier. However, Activepieces is superbly affordable. And for my simple use case of creating an automation flow for the apps that I frequently use (GSheet, Microsoft Excel, Wordpress, ChatGPT etc.), Activepieces would be more than enough, and even more than affordable.

And for my simple use case of creating an automation flow for the apps that I frequently use (GSheet, Microsoft Excel, Wordpress, ChatGPT etc.), Activepieces would be more than enough, and even more than affordable.

The completely customizable and fluid builder. The Code module is great and much better than Zapier. This took me less than an hour to rebuild everything I had in Zapier. The Community is second to none and it is very easy to install via docker on Windows 11, Asustor NAS, QNAP Nas, and in the cloud.
For us we process over 5000 runs a day, so it was getting incredibly expensive on zapier for my small business, ActivePieces has given us a cost effective way to automate everything.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Limited connections, sometimes slow interface, and difficult Piece building process.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Connecting all of our softwares and making them talk and work together to eliminate data entry and human errors has been tremendous.

Secondly, it integrates seamlessly with various marketing tools and platforms, ensuring smooth data flow and better campaign management. all_reviews.review_title: A solid alternative to Zapier
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces is a breath of fresh air when you compare it to the currently established Business Automation Tools, The fact it's Opensource and provides the ability to deploy a fully featured self hosted environment of AP free of charge allowing you to have as many flows as you want, for as many runs as you need is extremely competitive in the market and quite generous of the AP team.

AP offers many of the essential BA tools that you would need, Such as webhooks, Integrations with many common Google services such as Excel/Drive/Gmail and much more. And the interface provided is quite simple and clean, only showing the important details relevant to the current piece/flow you're working with.

And the best part is that it's only going to get better and larger! every week the team anounces new Pieces ready to be used in AP either from the awesome community contributors ( yey opensource! )  or the AP team themselves! So it's only a matter of time until AP catches up with industry giants like Zapier.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
I would like to see more detailed documentation for AP. I've struggled with some Pieces that had no documentation on the website.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use AP to automate very strenous manual labour involving transmitting form submissions from google forms to my own backend services, This would be nearly impossible to achieve a fully automated cycle of data transmission between completely seperate services if not for AP's Google Forms Trigger and many other Pieces that it offers

all_reviews.review_title: Easy, efficient Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces has been the easiest and most user friendly automation software I've used, I've found it extremely easy to set up flows and get automations up and running in a very short space of time.
The community site and discord servers are very active and have lots of information, definitely worth checking out if you ever get stuck.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Sometimes the documentation can be quite vague around pieces, it's definitely improving but showing use cases of how core pieces can be implemented would be really helpful. Luckily there are examples from users on youtube that show this.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces helps me connect my tech stack together. It enables me to set up automations to save time and save on manual tasks. If a software I'm using is missing functionality, instead of having to purchase another and migrate, I can use activepieces to connect my existing solutions and gain that functionality.

all_reviews.review_title: Visual workflow builder with great potential. *Update: lots of development and improvements last 6m
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
The custom code piece that allows you to use javascript and npm packages for lots of flexibility. *update: the new ai hints for custom code is fantastic! Also, the custom API builder got some nice improvements.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
*update after 6+ months: the team has been constantly updating the system and adding new integrations. The limited amount of native integrations available, which means you end up having to read the API docs for your apps and write the code yourself.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Integrating different apps and services, automating workflows. Mostly I use it in combination with no code builders like Knack and Frontly. A user action will trigger a webhook that then allows me to customize a workflow that might not be possible inside the app builder.

all_reviews.review_title: While the tools is clearly in early stage it growing rapidly !
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
It's very easy to get started. Major applications in the cloud have their components, and it's easy to integrate with any of them. As a developer, I'm also very happy to have an open ecosystem to work with. I can self-host the application, deploy it privately, and develop custom components for very specific projects while reusing common ones.

Modifications to existing components get approved quickly. Adding new components is relatively easy because all the building blocks already exist.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
As a developer, most of the time I can figure things out by looking at the code or searching the web for technical details. Documentation is probably the area where Activepieces still needs to improve, especially the online documentation. A good example is how to get ClientID and Secret from some integrations. Either the steps are absent or obsolete, which makes it a bit longer to integrate those flows.

Otherwise, the number of components and actions is behind Make or Zapier. But it is certainly growing rapidly, and as a developer, I'm very happy to contribute a little in that area with development in Odoo, Zoho CRM, Zoho Books, and others.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Quickly integrate multiple application in the cloud or on primise which could not be possible with Zapier and MAke because I cannot code my own components.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, open source and with a very active community
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
- It's open source so you can host it yourself. Their hosted version is awesome too with very competitive pricing.
- Integrations and autorhization with external services are handled very well.
- Community driven product with lots of contributors adding new "Pieces" (or integrations) all the time.
- You can develop your own pieces or integrations and then share them with the community!
- Lots of UX/UI improvements in the past months that make it really easy to integrate and debug flows (including incomining/outgoing webhooks which are a pain to impkement in some platforms)

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
- Some pieces are still missing some functionality depending on the third party service they connect to, so if you need to implement something specific be sure to check the related pieces documentation to see if the actions you need are supported (or, if you have a developer on hand, just go ahead and implement the required actions)

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
They help us automate flows that used to require custom development and shortening the time to launch in many cases.
We also get better visibility on flow execution and easier access to scheduling, maintenance and logs for non-developers.

The whitelabel allows you to customize at some level, but it could be extended.

all_reviews.review_title: A new name in the automation game
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces har got this clean, no-nonsense interface that takes complex automation and makes it feel like second nature. Support has been good too.

Their templates are top-notch, especially the latest ones for ChatGPT. Triggers? They've got them by the minute, hour, day--you name it. Diving into it, there's no need for a map or instructions. I just started poking around the templates and before I knew it, my workflow was running itself. It's that straightforward.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Their integrations are a bit on the lean side. Still, what I need is there, and I'm on the edge of my seat for what's next. More integrations and more templates is coming, so it will be fun to see if they can match the likes of Zapier etc.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Stringing together my other apps in an easy way, allowing me to make all kinds of no code automations to simplify my business (and life)

all_reviews.review_title: Activepieces - an emerging player in automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I love that Activepieces offer various complicated features for automation with a very simple and intuitive interface.

I also like that Activepieces has a lot of great "templates" for the automations. The newly added ones regarding ChatGPT are simply super handy.

Activepieces also have great triggers like timing trigger, such as Every hour, Every Day, Every minute etc.

And the user experience is smooth and convenient. I don't really need specific guide, just exploring templates and I have been able to create the "flows" to automate my workflow with ease.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
The integrations can definitely be better. Currently the apps integrated into Activepieces are limited, and the speed of apps integration can be faster. Anyway, most of the apps I need are there now and I am excitedly waiting for new integrations to come in the future.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces introduced a very simple approach for automation. Perhaps the easiest automation apps amongst those I have. I can integrate my apps with only a few clicks with Activepieces in just a few minutes, with barely any tutorial or guidance.

Certainly it cannot be compared right now with industry leaders such as Zappier. However, Activepieces is superbly affordable. And for my simple use case of creating an automation flow for the apps that I frequently use (GSheet, Microsoft Excel, Wordpress, ChatGPT etc.), Activepieces would be more than enough, and even more than affordable.

all_reviews.review_title: About time that workflow automation goes open source!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces first came on my radar via Hacker News in early 2023, I immediately starred them on GitHub and have been following their progress ever since.

Admittedly I haven't had much of a chance to make use of it until recently, but this weekend I worked on a small personal project which required some automation, and Activepieces immediately sprung to mind. I got set up on their Cloud version and managed to get my workflow sorted in minutes - no Docs or tutorials required. Connecting to external tools was as easy as clicking a few buttons.

I also love the fact that I can self host this and use it for free if I needed to. Zapier and others are incredibly expensive.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Given how young this project is, the experience isn't as polished as some of the more established vendors. Would love a dark mode, as well as the ability to view the workflows horizontally as well as vertically. Oh, and more connectors are always welcome :)

That being said, it's only a matter of time until Ashraf and the team catch up given the rapid pace of development and innovation. Excited to see great things from you guys over the next few years!

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
As it stands, currently, I am only using it for small personal projects, although I would definitely consider leveraging this for business in a startup or SMB. Don't think Activepieces is quite enterprise-ready yet, but given the Y Combinator backing I have a little doubt they will get there :)

all_reviews.review_title: Activepieces: A Hands-On Review of the Open Source Automation Gem with Room to Grow
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
The best thing about Activepieces is its user-friendly interface. It's just so easy to set up and manage workflows without needing to be a tech wizard. The integrations are another huge plus - being able to connect all my apps and services smoothly is a game-changer.

Most helpful is definitely the community support. Having access to a group of users and developers on Discord means I can get answers and share ideas quickly, which is super helpful when I'm stuck or looking to do something new.

The upsides are the open-source nature, the fair pricing, and the innovative use of AI. It feels good to have control, knowing I can host it myself and not worry about unexpected costs. And the AI features are a big bonus, especially for scaling up content and automating complex tasks efficiently.

Using Activepieces just makes the whole automation process more efficient and less of a headache. It's reliable, intuitive, and backed by a great community - that's a winning combo in my book!

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
It's a  lesser-known tool compared to giants like Zapier, it may not always have the same level of third-party support or an extensive library of pre-built 'Zaps' or automations that can save time during setup.

So while Activepieces is powerful and cost-effective, there's a balance to be struck considering the community support structure, learning curve for advanced features, and the breadth of pre-built integrations compared to some of its competitors.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces is solving the problem of workflow automation across various apps and services. By allowing me to connect different tools like Google Sheets, Stripe, and MailChimp, it eliminates the need for manual data entry and the potential for human error. This has been a significant time-saver for me, freeing up hours that I can now spend on more strategic tasks.

It's also helping with content scaling, particularly through its AI integrations, like automating SEO content creation directly within WordPress. This has benefited me by driving more organic traffic while keeping content production costs down.

Another business problem it addresses is lead nurturing and customer interaction. With Activepieces, I can automate welcome emails and other communication based on customer actions, which streamlines the customer journey and improves engagement without additional manpower.

Overall, Activepieces is benefiting me by increasing efficiency, reducing manual workload, and enhancing customer engagement--all of which contribute to a leaner operation with the potential for better scalability and growth.

We  appreciate that the interface of Activepieces is similar to other applications we are currently using. This prevents us from having to invest time and effort into learning a completely new user interface.  This made our implemention of the application a smoother experience for the team.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
One of the aspects that disappoints us the most about Activepieces is the limited number of templates available. The interface feels like there should be a wider range of templates to select from in order to kickstart our automation flow.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces provides us an additional reliable alternative for task and data flow automation so that we aren't reliant on a single application to manage all of our data and task flow.  If there were to be a problem with one of the other applications we use, Activepieces is available for redundancy.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I really like this software because it lets you build flows that automate and streamline processes. For me thats content and commerce workflows.  You can set up triggers to determine when the flow is executed, like on a schedule or when a specific event happens. And the actions you can take after the trigger are pretty cool too - you can run code or connect with other services. It's super handy in real-life production situations because it simplifies tasks and makes things more efficient. Overall, it's just really awesome!

It's exciting to see this growth, but it also raises concerns about the staying power and community interest of each platform. Personally, I have high hopes for ActivePieces and its potential to quickly expand its offering by adding more useful pieces. They have  some cool features that make ActivePieces truly stand out from the rest. Still waiting on FB to be approved but thats why I hava a few other tools in my automation stack while thats being resolved.

all_reviews.review_title: Lovely piece of software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
My experience with Activepieces has been quite good. In my opinion, one of the standout features of Activepieces is its workflow creation process. It's intuitive and streamlined, making designing and managing workflows very easy. The platform's attention to user experience is evident, ensuring that even complex workflows are manageable for all users.

Another aspect of Activepieces that enhanced my workflow automation capabilities is its JavaScript integration. This feature empowers me to create complex scenarios and manipulate data in real time before it's sent to its designated destination. This level of flexibility and control is invaluable, especially when dealing with data-driven processes.

Activepieces has provided me with an exceptional workflow automation experience thanks to its user-friendly interface and powerful JavaScript integration.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
While I generally enjoy working with Activepieces, there are a few aspects that I find a bit frustrating. Firstly, the platform lacks an auto-retry feature for failed executions. When a workflow doesn't execute successfully, I have to manually review and re-execute it, which can be time-consuming, especially when multiple failures occur. It would significantly enhance the user experience if Activepieces implemented an automatic retry mechanism to alleviate this issue.

Additionally, I've found the execution log to be quite basic. It would be immensely helpful if Activepieces could provide more advanced features for log management. For instance, filtering logs by specific flows or searching for specific text within the execution log would greatly enhance troubleshooting and monitoring capabilities. These improvements would streamline the process of identifying and addressing issues within workflows.

Another concern is integrating services and their corresponding triggers and actions within Activepieces. While the platform offers a good range of integrations, it isn't very reassuring to see that not all available triggers and actions from external services are fully integrated. In some cases, only a subset of these capabilities is accessible within Activepieces. To deliver a more robust user experience, it would be beneficial for the Activepieces team to take a more comprehensive approach when integrating external services, ensuring that all available triggers and actions are accessible to users.

My experience with Activepieces has been positive overall, but there is room for improvement.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces benefits me by simplifying complex automation tasks, enabling customization, and providing various integration options. It has made my workflow automation more efficient, reliable, and adaptable to my specific needs.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Affordability: ActivePieces offers a competitive price point, making it accessible for both fun and professional projects.

Open-Source Advantage: The transparency and potential for community-driven enhancements due to its open-source nature are commendable.

I am not very savvy but I find it easy to figure out.

It supports reading RSS feeds and Chat GPT for automated content.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Integration Limitations: The platform currently lacks support for Facebook and Meta. When benchmarked against established platforms like Pabbly and Zapier, ActivePieces has fewer integration options.

With less than 200 Activepieces supported you have to be a little deliberate with what you connect.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Affordability for Experimentation: The pricing of ActivePieces is budget-friendly, allowing you to use the platform for fun projects without a significant financial commitment. This makes it ideal for tinkering and experimenting with different automations and integrations.

Work Automation: ActivePieces aids in automating specific tasks for your work projects, particularly in moving form data around. This automation can save time, reduce manual errors, and streamline workflows.

Open-Source Flexibility: Being open-source, ActivePieces offers transparency and the potential for community-driven improvements. This means you have the possibility to customize or expand its functionalities if needed, or even contribute to its development.

Alternative to Mainstream Platforms: While it may have limited integrations compared to more established platforms like Pabbly or Zapier, ActivePieces provides a viable alternative for those who prioritize open-source solutions and affordability.

The platform is rapidly expanding with new services being added at an impressive pace. The community is vibrant and supportive, making it easy to get answers or feedback when needed.

Activepieces has been tool in automating substantial parts of my business, from marketing and online sales to product labeling and shipping.

all_reviews.review_title: Someday (probably) but not today
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces is open-source so I have no doubt that it will be further developed pretty quickly.
*IF* you're tech savvy, you could probably get AP to do pretty much anything you wanted it to.
It works well when generating ai content through the open.ai integration.
There is also a discord community that appears to be pretty active.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
While it may happen *someday*, I don't anticipate AP replacing tools like Zapier anytime in the foreseeable future. It isn't even currently in the same arena to be considered a contender.
Activepieces requires strong tech skills to be useful - even instruction pieces are written in jargon that wouldn't be understood by the average software user.

I can do basic coding and am pretty tech savvy. AP gave me a migraine after spending hours trying to get it to do anything that would be beneficial in connecting my current tech stack. - I finally resigned to plopping in my open.ai api and generating a few ai blog drafts to my Wordpress site. While they'll never actually see the light of day (and there were bugs which wouldn't make me feel confident autoposting anyways), I was just that desperate for some self-efficacy gratification.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
It isn't. It does have potential if they added more integrations, made the UI more friendly to average user, and provided instructions with less jargon.

all_reviews.review_title: Using it as a software developer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I am a software developer and starting my SaaS business.
I compared all the alternatives to Zapier that is really expensive, and found ActivePieces.
Much more cheaper than the competitors, it's true that they don't have all the integrations from Zapier but it's moving very fast!
Now I'm using it to call some workflow from my code app with Webhooks. It's perfect because I don't have to code all the complex integrations inside my code, and can change quickly things.
It's a bit similar to N8N, you can create branch with conditions, but also easier than N8N.

Last thing that I would have to mention : it's an open source project, so if you have a developper in your team, it's really easy to code your own integration (called "piece")
I had to call Mixpanel from my workflow, but there was no integration. I could create it in one hour with typescript and submit it to the community. 2 days after, it was released on the plateform!
If I would have used Zapier, I could not make this on my own, I would have to wait that one day, they add this integrations... So love that this is open source

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Less integrations than Zapier, but I can add them as a developer

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automate things that are complicated to do in code, because most of integrations need Oauth authentification

Using Activepieces is like having a team of extra VAs. We combined the time-based triggers with OpenAI to create content more efficiently than ever before. Activepeices is allowing my business to not double-handle data between applications, saving a mountain of time to focus on our client's needs.

all_reviews.review_title: The Perfect Blend of Power and Simplicity
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Being in the tech space, I've tried a handful of automation tools. Activepieces truly stand out, and here's why:

- With over 130+ apps available, it seamlessly plugs into most of my existing tools.

- Open-Source Advantage: The ability to tinker and customize is a developer's dream. Plus, there's a whole community out there refining and expanding it.

- Being supported by Y Combinator speaks volumes. It's not just another tool; it has a solid foundation and vision. I consider this as the most important thing as this will keep this project running and compete with Zapier and other established players in the market.

- Cloud & Community Versions: I appreciate the dual options. The cloud version offers ease, while the community version provides control for those who want it. I am also considering installing the community version on my server for testing soon.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
While there's a lot to love, there are areas of improvement:

- As with any new tool, it has its limitations. I'd love to see more "pieces" added soon.

- A more comprehensive guide would be a boon, especially for newcomers. I would love to see a series of onboarding video tutorials

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces came as a solution when I was grappling with pricey automation tools. The savings have been substantial! It feels like having Zapier's capabilities but without draining our budget. There is a bit of a learning curve - especially if you're not into coding - but, for me, that's a small trade-off for the freedom its open-source model offers. I'm eagerly waiting for more integrations. Once those are in place, I genuinely believe Activepieces will be the only automation tool we'd ever need.

all_reviews.review_title: Activepieces: Your Go-To for Easy Automation and a Great Community Vibe
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I've got to say, Activepieces has been a game changer for me. It's super user-friendly - I mean, you don't have to be a tech genius to get things rolling. What really makes it stand out is the community. There's this awesome vibe on their GitHub and Discord - people are always ready to help out or share some cool ideas. And let's talk cost - it's seriously wallet-friendly, giving you a bang for your buck without skimping on quality. Plus, it's open-source. That means a lot of transparency and room for us users to pitch in with improvements. They're always adding new stuff, which keeps things exciting. The integrations work like a charm too, especially with the AI features they've thrown in. It's pretty neat!

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Alright, it's not all sunshine and rainbows. They could do with more apps and integrations - it feels a bit limited at times. And hey, a few more onboarding guides or video tutorials wouldn't hurt, especially for newbies. If you're diving into the more advanced stuff, be prepared for a bit of a learning curve. I've also noticed they're missing an auto-retry feature for when things don't go as planned, and the execution logs are pretty basic. It's not a deal-breaker, but these are little things that could make a big difference.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Streamlining Workflows: Before Activepieces, juggling different apps and tools was a bit of a headache. Now, I can automate tasks across various platforms, like syncing data between Google Sheets and MailChimp. It's a huge time-saver and keeps me from doing the same tedious stuff over and over.

Reducing Manual Errors: By automating repetitive tasks, I'm cutting down on those little mistakes that creep in when you're entering data manually. It's like having a safety net that keeps things accurate and consistent.

Boosting Efficiency: I'm all about efficiency, and Activepieces is a big help here. Automating workflows means I spend less time on routine tasks and more on the creative or strategic parts of my work. It's freeing up hours in my week that I can use way better.

all_reviews.review_title: Replaces Make easily for most tasks
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
One you understand its philosophy, ActivePieces is very easy to build with. The visual builder is very intuitive, and the no-code pieces are amazing. If your favourite piece is missing, there's always the HTTP module, and a Code module - so you're virtually unlimited in what you can do. I'm currently transferring most of my Make automations to ActivePieces so these would be running daily. Customer support is very active on their forum and jumps in whenever required.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Native integrations (pieces) can do with updating (some pieces have only 1-2 actions while the API of the software supports tens of actions). Or adding new pieces. OAuth authorisation for HTTP is missing. But otherwise, it's an outstanding piece of software.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces is the backbone of my business. I automate my Marketing workflow, my SaaS back-end workflows through ActivePieces. It saves me having to scrimp on automations with Make, or on the need to learn how to code.

all_reviews.review_title: Rising star on the automation tool horizon
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I got aware of activepieces because it's an open-source automation tool. I realy liked to have the choice between self-hosting and the cloud platform. I started using it as self-hosted docker container.
Later, I switched to the cloud offering as the Appsumo deal was exactly what I wanted. But their monthly offerings are also well worth it.

I also think it's awesome everyone can help to improve the software on Github. Each monthly release is more mature regarding integrations.

The intuitive no-code builder gets you started with integrations in now time. But the tool doesn't hold you back and lets you also use code, when really needed.

I found all information to get started through their Community. They also have a Discord server to get help. The more expensive Platform and Enterprise plans also get email or dedicated support.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Activepieces is a rather young project. But I'm convinced it will have a bright future. Some integrations are still being worked on and need more time to mature.

Even the tool is user friendly, I think activepieces is best used by tech-savvy users.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us to automate workflows between different SaaS solutuions.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for Tech-y people
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I work in Software Engineering, so when I saw an open-source alternative to pricey Zapier, I got interested straight away.

I've already implemented a few pretty complicated flows, such as exporting data from Fullstory (no piece for it yet but I'm going to create one), parsing data to extract users and then send it to our internal service that sends NPS surveys to our customers. It works! :)

I like the flexibility of built-in Code piece that allows you not only to run some basic code but actually provide dependencies to you JS/TS logic. Also, I found the way of passing outputs to inputs pretty straightforward.

Having already 3.5k starts on GitHub and being backed by YCombinator I'm sure the tool has very high chance for success. Yes, it doesn't have pieces for everything just yet, but the community will help driving it forward.

Definitely recommend you the service, especially if you're on the tech side!

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
- The documentation for pieces is pretty sparse as of now.
- There are some alternatives in the market providing more out-of-the box
- I wasn't able to find Secrets Manager to store passwords in it

I believe that these things will be handled by the creators and community soon though.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automate boring work. Eg send emails to users when they click on a button on our site.

all_reviews.review_content:

1- Zapier is expensive. I dont like paying monthly.

2- Active pieces is open source. I am an open source guy. It has proved to produce some of the most robust software over time. Active pieces might seem new now, but over time and the power of community I believe it will overtake Zapier and make. Look how powerful is linux as an operating system.

3- I checked the company information, they are backed by Ycombinator!
For those who don't know what it is, it is one of the most prestigious accelerators in the silicon valley, if not the most prestigious. Getting admitted there is like getting admitted to Stanford. Those guys made it in, they have to have something promising to be selected and Funded by YC. And most importantly, they are not going away anytime soon.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
While I am not a hardcore developer, I propose to the founders to finetune an AI chat and train it to write pieces for non coders like me.
I can simply provide it with the API variables and it would write me the code to paste it and make a piece.
This will accelerate the growth of the platform and help guys like me.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?

I found ActivePieces so easy to use, and I created my first automation flows without reading any ActivePieces documentation. I have other similar automation apps but it takes me so long to create and test new automations with them and often I can't create the flows I want because of the complexity in setting up each step of the flow.
I tested creating one flow with Activepieces where I had spent about an hour researching all the apis and authentications required of external apps to connect with them, and I didn't find it easy or intuitive to create the flow. When I tested creating the same flow in Activepieces it took about 2 minutes and all I then had to do was configure each step's options, which when I looked into the configuration settings of each step, I saw the configuring also taking a few minutes. However, I then stopped because I started to re-think all the use cases I had wanted to previously create with other automation apps and had not, and which tasks to prioritise because my mind kept coming up with new use cases using Activepieces for tasks for myself and my clients. I really recommend Activepieces to anyone considering automating frequent manual tasks, and I also recommend it to existing automation creators using other automation apps who may want to look at speed up their automation creation process. Support on thier Discord channel and website community has been very active and well as the community's self help and contributions.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Activepieces seems to be a new automation app and may not currently have all the apps in their Pieces that you wish to integrate. From updates in their Discord group, existing Pieces are developed with new functions and new Pieces are added on an ongoing basis.
However the webhook feature (Piece) should allow you to receive data from any app that can send data using webhooks, and the 'Send HTTP request' feature (Piece) should be able to send any data from your flow to any other apps that can receive HHTP requests.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces helps me create automation flows much quicker than other automation apps and the speed of use encourages me to create and test automation flows that I've avoided with other automation apps.

all_reviews.review_title: Budget-Friendly Automation with Community Power
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
ActivePieces is an absolute game-changer! Why? Well, it's like this fantastic DIY project with a vibrant community vibe over on GitHub. You've got the power to tweak things to your heart's content, and there's a supportive community right there by your side.

And the best part? It won't put a dent in your wallet, unlike those pricier alternatives. ActivePieces is budget-friendly and gives you exceptional value for your money - truly a win-win situation.

The ActivePieces community is incredibly active and tightly-knit. You're never in this journey alone. It's constantly evolving, introducing cool new features and adding new App (Pieces).

I've begun migrating some of my tasks to ActivePieces, and it's been a breeze. Yes, it's intuitive, so there's no steep learning curve. It's got me thinking that in the next year, I might just take the leap and move my entire business here, bidding farewell to my Make subscription and saving even more.

So, yeah, ActivePieces is my ultimate choice for budget-friendly, community-driven automation. It's super user-friendly, and I'm absolutely loving the experience!

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
The only downside is that it's not as widely integrated as some of the bigger players in the game. I'm still eagerly waiting for a few key integrations, like Facebook, to be approved. That's why I've got a few other tools in my automation toolkit while that gets sorted.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
ActivePieces is a game-changer because it streamlines and automates processes, making my workflow a breeze. It's all about process workflow automation. It's not just budget-friendly, I can experiment with different automations and integrations without breaking the bank.

all_reviews.review_title: Good design + ChatGPT integration for the win
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
There's no shortage of connector services but I am a sucker for good design - the combination of Activepieces' ease of use and looks is irresistible. Design is always a differentiator for me. The recent update that creates your own chatbots using ChatGPT and Activepieces is the icing on the cake, for I can replace specialized chatbot services with Activepieces and make use of the other connections as well. TBH, that alone is worth the investment for me.

Activepieces is a promising investment; while I am signed up for the cloud service, the fact that it's open source gives me comfort. Good design + AI integration for the win as far as I am concerned.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Not enough integrations to be a full blown Zapier replacement

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's a connector service, so it helps us route data from A to B. Initially we were interested in going from RSS feeds to Google Sheets for our content strategy, but the new chatbots trained on our data makes it possible to create subtle workflows that use AI to respond to blog posts and other content we are tracking. Very useful!

all_reviews.review_content:

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
Currently, there are not very many pieces (integrations). But since the entire platform is open source, we are able to write our own or make a request within the community if the need arises for an integration not currently offered. This is not the case with a closed source platform like Zapier.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
We automate multiple workflows within our business and for our clients. This tool allows us to set up and test workflows very rapidly and then get them running so that we're saving hours per month.

all_reviews.review_title: Affordable Automation with Endless Potential
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
Activepieces is an awesome automation solution that really stands out for being affordable and packed with great features. It can easily compete with other tools on the market, offering a wide range of capabilities at a fraction of the cost.

What I dig the most about Activepieces is how they keep on improving. The development team is clearly dedicated, constantly rolling out updates and new features. It's really cool to see their commitment to enhancing the user experience.

Adding more "pieces" would definitely make it even more appealing. And it would be super helpful to have a more detailed guide or a series of onboarding tutorials for newbies to get the most out of this powerful tool.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
One area that could use some work is customer support. Right now, it's handled on their community site and can be a bit slow, which can be frustrating for users who need quick solutions.

But overall, Activepieces is a promising platform and I'm genuinely excited about what the future holds. With the way they're constantly improving, it's definitely gonna be a game-changer for businesses looking to streamline their workflows efficiently.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Activepieces makes our lives so much easier by simplifying complex workflows. Tasks like reservation management and inventory tracking are a breeze, saving us loads of time and effort. This boost in efficiency really amps up our productivity, giving us more space to focus on improving customer experiences. Plus, the fact that it's super affordable frees up resources for us to invest in strategic business growth.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
What I like most about ActivePieces is its unwavering commitment to the open-source approach and the vibrant community it has cultivated in a short time. This dedication to openness and collaboration is truly commendable and sets ActivePieces apart in the world of automation software.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
While my experience with ActivePieces has been overwhelmingly positive, one potential concern I have is the possibility of other businesses copying their software due to its open-source nature. This could potentially dilute the uniqueness and innovation of ActivePieces. However, I am optimistic that the talented team behind ActivePieces will find effective ways to address this challenge and protect their intellectual property while still fostering open collaboration.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
In our business, ActivePieces serves as an invaluable no-code automation tool that empowers us to streamline our operations effortlessly. Its user-friendly interface and versatile functionality enable us to automate various tasks and seamlessly integrate third-party tools without the need for a complex backend or coding expertise. This efficiency boost has not only saved us time and resources but has also allowed us to focus on strategic initiatives, ultimately enhancing our overall productivity and competitiveness. ActivePieces has become an integral part of our workflow, driving efficiency and innovation across the board.

all_reviews.review_title: An excellent modular platform for data integrations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I've used activepieces over the last month

User experience is clean and responsive - finding how to do things was reasonably straightforward to do. The platform being open and extensible is a big strength, and there is a constant stream of updates to integrations

There is a good amount of flexibility using built in javascript steps - I found this super handy to create custom logic and calculations from data that had been collected by previous steps, and feeding that to conditional follow-on steps such as alerts and messages.

The team is very active and available on discord too which is great to see

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
It is a relatively young product in a competitive space where other products have many more mature integrations with services

With the open nature of the integrations (pieces) built into activepieces the gap will likely eventually close. And it gives some flexibility if I want to create my own custom integration to build that myself.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
Enabling data integration between disparate online services and having the ability to add additional logic and calculations to trigger data-driven events and messaging adds functionality to my online work with various other products I use.

all_reviews.review_title: Reviews of Activepieces
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Activepieces?
I like the fact that there is an active development community and the number of products we can collaborate on is increasing every day.
Also, the GUI is very easy to understand.

What do you dislike about Activepieces?
There are few publicly available APIs. Also, Activepieces' own user management (LDAP integration, OpenID authentication, etc.) cannot be externally linked, which is unsatisfactory.

What problems is Activepieces solving and how is that benefiting you?
User creation for products that do not support LDAP authentication can be performed via API.
